org.jetel.util.string

Class TagName

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jetel.util.string.TagName

  • public class TagName
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility to generate valid XML tag name from arbitrary string. Even that XML allows non-ASCII characters as a tag name, this utility encodes them as well as any special ASCII characters. These characters are encoded as "_xhhhh" where hhhh is the Unicode of the character as a hexa value. Public static methods of this class can be used in XPath of TreeReader mapping. See XmlXPathEvaluator.

      • encode

        public static java.lang.String encode(java.lang.String s,
                      boolean encodeSeqChar)
        Encodes given input string using unicodes. 
         Example:
 input: "@Funny*Tag-Name()"
 output: "_x0040Funny_x002aTag-Name_x0028_x0029"
        Parameters:
        s -
        encodeSeqChar - if SEQ_CHAR ('_') should be encoded
        Returns:
